translation.en: Last year I showed these two slides so that  demonstrate that the arctic ice cap,  which for most of the last three million years  has been the size of the lower 48 states,  has shrunk by 40 percent.
translation.zh: 去年我给各位展示了两个 关于北极冰帽的演示 在过去三百万年中 其面积由相当于美国南方48州面积总和 缩减了40%

translation.en: But this understates the seriousness of this particular problem  because it doesn't show the thickness of the ice.
translation.zh: 但这些没能完全说明这个问题的严重性 因为这没有表示出冰帽的厚度

translation.en: The arctic ice cap is, in a sense,  the beating heart of the global climate system.
translation.zh: 感觉上，北极冰帽 就好象全球气候系统中跳动的心脏

translation.en: It expands in winter and contracts in summer.
translation.zh: 冬天心脏舒张，夏天心脏收缩

translation.en: The next slide I show you will be  a rapid fast-forward of what's happened over the last 25 years.
translation.zh: 下面我要展示的是 在过去25年里的极剧变化

translation.en: The permanent ice is marked in red.
translation.zh: 红色的是永冻冰

translation.en: As you see, it expands to the dark blue --  that's the annual ice in winter,  and it contracts in summer.
translation.zh: 你看，它正在变成深蓝色 这是每年冬天形成的年度冰 在夏天永冻冰收缩

translation.en: The so-called permanent ice, five years old or older,  you can see is almost like blood,  spilling out of the body here.
translation.zh: 所谓的“永冻”，是指形成五年或更久的冰 你看，这也像血液一样 输送到身体各部位

translation.en: In 25 years it's gone from this, to this.
translation.zh: 在25年的时间里，它从这里，到了这里

translation.en: This is a problem because the warming  heats up the frozen ground around the Arctic Ocean,  where there is a massive amount of frozen carbon  which, when it thaws, is turned into methane by microbes.
translation.zh: 值得注意的是 温室效应使得北冰洋周围的冻土层受热 而这里有大量被冻封的碳 解冻时，微生物降解碳形成甲烷

translation.en: Compared to the total amount of global warming pollution in the atmosphere,  that amount could double if we cross this tipping point.
translation.zh: 如果突破顶点，温室气体排放量 将是现有大气层中的全球温室污染总量

translation.en: Already in some shallow lakes in Alaska,  methane is actively bubbling up out of the water.
translation.zh: 在阿拉斯加的一些浅湖里 已经可以看到水中探头的沼气泡

translation.en: Professor Katey Walter from the University of Alaska  went out with another team to another shallow lake last winter.
translation.zh: 去年冬天，University of Alaska的Katey Walter教授 结队去了一个浅湖

translation.en: Video: Whoa!   Al Gore: She's okay. The question is whether we will be.
translation.zh: 哇（开心而又惊叹滴笑） 戈尔：她很好，我们怎么样呢？

translation.en: And one reason is, this enormous heat sink  heats up Greenland from the north.
translation.zh: 有一个原因，北方沉积的大量热能 加热了格陵兰岛

translation.en: This is an annual melting river.
translation.zh: 这是一条每年融化的河

translation.en: But the volumes are much larger than ever.
translation.zh: 但流量却比往年都要大

translation.en: This is the Kangerlussuaq River in southwest Greenland.
translation.zh: 这是格陵兰岛西南的Kangerlussuaq河

translation.en: If you want to know how sea level rises  from land-base ice melting  this is where it reaches the sea.
translation.zh: 如果你想了解陆地上的冰块融化 如何使得海平面上升 这里就是它的入海口

translation.en: These flows are increasing very rapidly.
translation.zh: 这里的流量正在急速上升

translation.en: At the other end of the planet, Antarctica  the largest mass of ice on the planet.
translation.zh: 南极，地球的另一端 这个行星上最大的冰块

translation.en: Last month scientists reported the entire continent  is now in negative ice balance.
translation.zh: 上个月，科学家报告整个大洲 正处于冰量减少的阶段

translation.en: And west Antarctica cropped up on top some under-sea islands,  is particularly rapid in its melting.
translation.zh: 在南极洲的西部突然发现 几个低于海平面的岛屿正在加速融化

translation.en: That's equal to 20 feet of sea level, as is Greenland.
translation.zh: 这相当于海平面上20英尺，和格陵兰岛一样

translation.en: In the Himalayas, the third largest mass of ice:  at the top you see new lakes, which a few years ago were glaciers.
translation.zh: 在Himalayas,第三大冰块 在顶部你可以看到新的湖泊，而几年前，这只是冰河

translation.en: 40 percent of all the people in the world  get half of their drinking water from that melting flow.
translation.zh: 全球40%从其融水中 获得一半的饮用水

translation.en: In the Andes, this glacier is the  source of drinking water for this city.
translation.zh: 在安第斯山脉,这条冰河 是这座城市的饮用水源

translation.en: The flows have increased.
translation.zh: 流量正在增加

translation.en: But when they go away, so does much of the drinking water.
translation.zh: 但当它们消失时，我们也将失去饮用水

translation.en: In California there has been a 40 percent  decline in the Sierra snowpack.
translation.zh: 在California, Sierra的积雪 每年减少40%

translation.en: This is hitting the reservoirs.
translation.zh: 对于蓄水而言，这是一个打击

translation.en: And the predictions, as you've read, are serious.
translation.zh: 而且如你看到的，预计是非常严重的

translation.en: This drying around the world has lead to  a dramatic increase in fires.
translation.zh: 全球的干燥化 正在导致火灾数量急剧增加

translation.en: And the disasters around the world  have been increasing at an absolutely extraordinary  and unprecedented rate.
translation.zh: 而全世界的灾害数量 也正以绝对显著的 空前的速度增加

translation.en: Four times as many in the last 30 years  as in the previous 75.
translation.zh: 在过去三十年内，灾害总数达到了 更早七十五年总数的四倍

translation.en: This is a completely unsustainable pattern.
translation.zh: 这是一种完全不可持续的模式

translation.en: If you look at in the context of history  you can see what this is doing.
translation.zh: 如果看下历史 你可以看到发生了些什么

translation.en: In the last five years  we've added 70 million tons of CO2  25 million tons every day to the oceans.
translation.zh: 在过去的五年 我们每天 增加七千万吨二氧化碳 向海洋排放两千五百万吨二氧化碳

translation.en: Look carefully at the area of the eastern Pacific,  from the Americas, extending westward,  and on either side of the Indian subcontinent,  where there is a radical depletion of oxygen in the oceans.
translation.zh: 注意看下东太平洋区域 从美洲向西 在印度次大陆的两边 海洋含氧量急剧减少

translation.en: The biggest single cause of global warming,  along with deforestation, which is 20 percent of it, is the burning of fossil fuels.
translation.zh: 温室效应最大的原因，除了森林破坏占20%外 是燃烧石油燃料

translation.en: Oil is a problem, and coal is the most serious problem.
translation.zh: 石油很重要，煤炭最为紧要

translation.en: The United States is one of the two  largest emitters, along with China.
translation.zh: 美国 正成为全球最大的两个排放国之一，和中国一起

translation.en: And the proposal has been to build a lot more coal plants.
translation.zh: 解决方案曾经是建造一个使用更多煤碳的星球

translation.en: But we're beginning to see a sea change.
translation.zh: 但我们已经开始看到海洋的变化了

translation.en: Here are the ones that have been cancelled in the last few years  with some green alternatives proposed.
translation.zh: 这里是近年已经取消的一些 以及一些新的绿色替代方案

translation.en: However there is a political battle  And the coal industries and the oil industries  spent a quarter of a billion dollars in the last calendar year  promoting clean coal,  which is an oxymoron.
translation.zh: 但是，在我们国家 有一场政治战争 而煤碳和石油工业 在去年花费了两千五百万美元 来提倡清洁煤炭 这太矛盾了

translation.en: That image reminded me of something.
translation.zh: 那个画面让我想起了什么

translation.en: Around Christmas, in my home in Tennessee,  a billion gallons of coal sludge was spilled.
translation.zh: 圣诞前后，在我的家乡田纳西 挖出了几十亿升的煤淤泥

translation.en: You probably saw it on the news.
translation.zh: 可能你在新闻上看过

translation.en: This, all over the country, is the second largest waste stream in America.
translation.zh: 这里，是全美第二大的废水排放

translation.en: This happened around Christmas.
translation.zh: 这发生于圣诞前后

translation.en: One of the coal industry's ads around Christmas was this one.
translation.zh: 有一则这样的煤碳行业广告

translation.en: Video: ♪♫ Frosty the coal man is a jolly, happy soul.
translation.zh: 录象：♪♫煤炭酷先生是高兴和快乐的化身

translation.en: He's abundant here in America,  and he helps our economy grow.
translation.zh: 在美国你可以见到他富饶多产 他还帮助我们发展经济

translation.en: Frosty the coal man is getting cleaner everyday.
translation.zh: 煤炭酷先生每天都在变得更干净

translation.en: He's affordable and adorable, and workers keep their pay.
translation.zh: 他可爱实惠，为工人们带来工作机会

translation.en: Al Gore: This is the source of much of the coal in West Virginia.
translation.zh: 戈尔：这里是West Virginia，许多煤炭的原产地

translation.en: The largest mountaintop miner is the head of Massey Coal.
translation.zh: 最大的山顶采矿是head of Massey Coal

translation.en: Video: Don Blankenship: Let me be clear about it. Al Gore,  Nancy Pelosi, Harry Reid, they don't know what they're talking about.
translation.zh: Don Blankenship:让我来澄清事实（这个老兄是马塞能源公司总裁兼总经理，马赛能源公司被卷入一连串的法律与环境的争议当中，争议主要存在于其开采过程中没有采取相应的防污措施） Al Core, Nancy Pelosi（现任众议院议长）, Harry Reid（众议院能源和商业委员会主席）（这两个人都致力于通过国会推动一项综合性的能源与气候议案），这帮家伙完全不懂得他们在讲些什么

translation.en: Al Gore: So the Alliance for Climate Protection  has launched two campaigns.
translation.zh: 戈尔：所以气候保护联盟 开展了两个项目

translation.en: This is one of them, part of one of them.
translation.zh: 这是其中的一个，其中一个的一部分

translation.en: Video: Actor: At COALergy we view climate change as a very serious  threat to our business.
translation.zh: 演员：在COALergy，我们非常严肃地对待 气候变化对我们的事业威胁

translation.en: That's why we've made it our primary goal  to spend a large sum of money  on an advertising effort to help bring out and complicate  the truth about coal.
translation.zh: 这是为什么我们花费大量金钱 制定我们的最初目标 努力挖掘并阐释 煤炭的真相

translation.en: The fact is, coal isn't dirty.
translation.zh: 事实上，煤炭并不肮脏

translation.en: We think it's clean --  smells good, too.
translation.zh: 我们认为，它是干净的 好闻的

translation.en: So don't worry about climate change.
translation.zh: 因此，不必为全球变暖而担心

translation.en: Leave that up to us.
translation.zh: 让我们来搞定吧

translation.en: Video: Actor: Clean coal -- you've heard a lot about it.
translation.zh: 演员：清洁煤炭，你已经听过关于它的许多

translation.en: So let's take a tour of this state-of-the-art clean coal facility.
translation.zh: 所以，让我们去看看如同艺术一般的清洁煤炭工厂吧

translation.en: Amazing! The machinery is kind of loud.
translation.zh: 壮观！机器有些喧哗

translation.en: But that's the sound of clean coal technology.
translation.zh: 但这是清洁煤炭技术的声音

translation.en: And while burning coal is one of the leading causes of global warming,  the remarkable clean coal technology you see here  changes everything.
translation.zh: 虽然烧煤是导致全球变暖的主要原因之一 你在这里所见到的令人折服的清洁煤炭技术 改变了一切

translation.en: Take a good long look: this is today's clean coal technology.
translation.zh: 好好看看吧！这就是如今的清洁煤炭技术

translation.en: Al Gore: Finally, the positive alternative  meshes with our economic challenge  and our national security challenge.
translation.zh: 戈尔：最后是这个正面的方案 可以应对经济挑战 和国家安全挑战

translation.en: Video: Narrator: America is in crisis -- the economy,  national security, the climate crisis.
translation.zh: 录象：旁白:美国正处于危机 经济的、国家安全的、气候的危机

translation.en: The thread that links them all:  our addiction to carbon based fuels,  like dirty coal and foreign oil.
translation.zh: 将这些危机都串在一起的 是我们对于基于碳的石油产品的依赖 譬如肮脏的煤炭和进口的石油

translation.en: But now there is a bold new solution to get us out of this mess.
translation.zh: 但现在，有一种全新的解决这些难题的方案 Repower America

translation.en: Repower America with 100 percent clean electricity  within 10 years.
translation.zh: 用百分百清洁的电力 用十年的时间

translation.en: A plan to put America back to work,  make us more secure, and help stop global warming.
translation.zh: 让美国人全新获得工作 让我们生活得更安全，并且让地球不在变暖

translation.en: Finally, a solution that's big enough to solve our problems.
translation.zh: 最终，一个足够庞大的方案来解决我们的问题

translation.en: Repower America. Find out more.
translation.zh: Repower America ，了解更多

translation.en: Al Gore: This is the last one.
translation.zh: 戈尔：最后一个

translation.en: Video: Narrator: It's about repowering America.
translation.zh: 旁白：这是关于Repower America的

translation.en: One of the fastest ways to cut our dependence  on old dirty fuels that are killing our planet.
translation.zh: 陈旧的肮脏石油正在谋杀我们的星球 这是让我们减少对其依赖的最快方式

translation.en: Man: Future's over here. Wind, sun, a new energy grid.
translation.zh: 男A：未来就在这里。风力、太阳能、新的能源网络

translation.en: Man #2: New investments to create high-paying jobs.
translation.zh: 男B：新的投资创造更的报酬丰厚的工作

translation.en: Narrator: Repower America. It's time to get real.
translation.zh: 旁白：Repower America 。是时候梦想成真了！

translation.en: Al Gore: There is an old African proverb that says,  "If you want to go quickly, go alone.
translation.zh: 戈尔：有一条古老的非洲谚语 如果想要走得快，独立前行

translation.en: If you want to go far, go together."
translation.zh: 如果想要走得远，结伴前行

translation.en: We need to go far, quickly.
translation.zh: 我们需要的是走得远，而且快

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 非常感谢

translation.en: Last year at TED I gave an introduction to the LHC.
translation.zh: 在去年的TED发言上我介绍了LHC

translation.en: And I promised to come back and give you an update  on how that machine worked.
translation.zh: 而且我说过一定回来给大家实况更新 说说机器的运转情况

translation.en: So this is it. And for those of you that weren't there,  the LHC is the largest scientific experiment ever attempted --  27 kilometers in circumference.
translation.zh: 这就是它，如果你去年没来的话 LHC是史上最大规模的科学实验 周长27公里

translation.en: Its job is to recreate the conditions  that were present less than a billionth of a second after the universe began,  up to 600 million times a second.
translation.zh: 用来重塑宇宙形成 十亿分之一秒时的状态 每秒制造6亿次

translation.en: It's nothing if not ambitious.
translation.zh: 非常具有野心

translation.en: This is the machine below Geneva.
translation.zh: 这就是在日内瓦地下的机械

translation.en: We take the pictures of those mini-Big Bangs inside detectors.
translation.zh: 我们用这些探测器给迷你大爆炸照相

translation.en: This is the one I work on. It's called the ATLAS detector --  44 meters wide, 22 meters in diameter.
translation.zh: 这个是我就职的那台，ATLAS探测器 44米长，直径22米

translation.en: Spectacular picture here of ATLAS under construction  so you can see the scale.
translation.zh: 这是ATLAS建造过程中的壮观景象 可以看出规模巨大

translation.en: On the 10th of September last year we turned the machine on for the first time.
translation.zh: 去年9月10日我们第一次启动这一机器

translation.en: And this picture was taken by ATLAS.
translation.zh: 这是一张ATLAS照下的照片

translation.en: It caused immense celebration in the control room.
translation.zh: 当时控制室里欢呼雀跃

translation.en: It's a picture of the first beam particle  going all the way around the LHC,  colliding with a piece of the LHC deliberately,  and showering particles into the detector.
translation.zh: 这是第一簇粒子的照片 一路沿着LHC转圈 如我们所计划地与LHC的一部分相撞 大量粒子在探测器内辐散

translation.en: In other words, when we saw that picture on September 10th  we knew the machine worked,  which is a great triumph.
translation.zh: 换句话说，当我们在9月10号看到这一景象时 我们知道这机器起作用了 这是个巨大的成功

translation.en: I don't know whether this got the biggest cheer,  or this, when someone went onto Google  and saw the front page was like that.
translation.zh: 我不知道是这个获得了满堂喝彩 还是这个——当人们登陆谷歌 看见首页图标是这样的时候

translation.en: It means we made cultural impact  as well as scientific impact.
translation.zh: 这表明我们的工作造成了文化冲击 这与它的科研冲击同样意义重大

translation.en: About a week later we had a problem with the machine,  related actually to these bits of wire here -- these gold wires.
translation.zh: 但是大概一周之后我们的机器出了点故障 主要跟这些导线有关——这些金色的导线

translation.en: Those wires carry 13 thousand amps  when the machine is working in full power.
translation.zh: 这些导线传导1万3千安培电流 当机器全部启动

translation.en: Now the engineers amongst you will look at them and say,  "No they don't. They're small wires."
translation.zh: 现在你们之中的一些工程师可能会说 “不可能，这些电线太细了”

translation.en: They can do that because  when they are very cold they are what's called superconducting wire.
translation.zh: 它们能做到 因为当温度极低它们就成了超导导线

translation.en: So at minus 271 degrees,  colder than the space between the stars,  those wires can take that current.
translation.zh: 所以在零下271摄氏度 低于星球间宇宙空间的温度的情况下 这些导线可以传导如此强的电流

translation.en: In one of the joints between over 9,000 magnets in LHC,  there was a manufacturing defect.
translation.zh: 在LHC中九千多个电磁铁里的一个接点上 有一个安装技术失误

translation.en: So the wire heated up slightly,  and its 13,000 amps suddenly encountered electrical resistance.
translation.zh: 于是导线温度微微升高了一点 导致它传导的1万3千安培电流忽然受到电阻

translation.en: This was the result.
translation.zh: 这就是结果

translation.en: Now that's more impressive  when you consider those magnets weigh over 20 tons,  and they moved about a foot.
translation.zh: 非常令人震惊 因为那些磁铁重达20吨 它们移动了大约一英尺

translation.en: So we damaged about 50 of the magnets.
translation.zh: 一共大概有50个磁铁受损

translation.en: We had to take them out, which we did.
translation.zh: 必须得把它们卸下来，这些工作已经完成

translation.en: We reconditioned them all, fixed them.
translation.zh: 我们给它们排除故障，修理好

translation.en: They're all on their way back underground now.
translation.zh: 现在就等着它们重新回到地下了

translation.en: By the end of March the LHC will be intact again.
translation.zh: 在三月底左右LHC被重新接通

translation.en: We will switch it on,  and we expect to take data in June or July,  and continue with our quest to find out  what the building blocks of the universe are.
translation.zh: 我们将会启动它 并且希望在六七月的时候得到数据 然后继续我们的使命 找出宇宙形成的最基本单位

translation.en: Now of course, in a way  those accidents reignite the debate  about the value of science and engineering at the edge. It's easy to refute.
translation.zh: 很明显现在，一方面 这些事故重新激化了关于 前沿科学和工程学的辩论，但这些很容易被反驳

translation.en: I think that the fact that it's so difficult,  the fact that we're overreaching, is the value of things like the LHC.
translation.zh: 我认为这任务过于艰难却仍令 我们执着追求的事实本身，就是LHC的价值所在

translation.en: I will leave the final word to an English scientist, Humphrey Davy,  who, I suspect,  when defending his protege's useless experiments --  his protege was Michael Faraday --  said this, "Nothing is so dangerous  to the progress of the human mind  than to assume that our views of science are ultimate,  that there are no mysteries in nature,  that our triumphs are complete, and that  there are no new worlds to conquer."
translation.zh: 最后我愿复述一位英国科学家戴维翰弗瑞的话 我记得他 在为自己学徒无意义的实验辩护时 ——他的学徒是迈克尔法拉第—— 说过：对于人类头脑发展来说 没有什么比这想法更为危险： 认为我们已经理解了科学之所有 一切谜团尽已揭开 人类已经大获全胜 而停止对新知的探索

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: I want to start out by asking you to think back to when you were a kid,  playing with blocks.
translation.zh: 首先，我想请大家回忆一下你们在孩提时代 玩过的积木。

translation.en: As you figured out how to reach out and grasp,  pick them up and move them around,  you were actually learning how to think and solve problems  by understanding and manipulating spatial relationships.
translation.zh: 当你构思着怎么去搭建积木 并且去动手操作的时候， 其实是你正在学习怎样思考和解决问题。 这即是对物体的空间结构的理解和感知。

translation.en: Spatial reasoning is deeply connected  to how we understand a lot of the world around us.
translation.zh: 理解物体的空间结构非常有助于 我们对很多周围事物的学习。

translation.en: So, as a computer scientist  inspired by this utility of our interactions with physical objects --  along with my adviser Pattie, and my collaborator Jeevan Kalanithi --  I started to wonder -- what if when we used a computer,  instead of having this one mouse cursor that was a like a digital fingertip  moving around a flat desktop,  what if we could reach in with both hands and grasp information physically,
translation.zh: 因此，作为一个计算机领域的科学家， 在这种手动思考方式的启发下， 以及在我的导师Pattie和我的合作伙伴Jeevan Kalanithi的帮助下， 我开始思考--要是我们能用一种新型计算机 来代替鼠标移动光标，就好比一种数字化的手指尖 在桌面移动--那样会如何呢？ 要是我们能用手来直接感知信息，

translation.en: arranging it the way we wanted?
translation.zh: 按我们的思路来组合信息--那样会如何呢？

translation.en: This question was so compelling that we decided to explore the answer,  by building Siftables.
translation.zh: 这样的疑问不断萦绕在我的脑海中，于是我们决定去探寻答案， 所以才有了这款Siftables。

translation.en: In a nutshell, a Siftable is an interactive computer  the size of a cookie.
translation.zh: 简单地说，Siftable是一款互动计算机， 体积如饼干般大小。

translation.en: They're able to be moved around by hand,  they can sense each other, they can sense their motion,  and they have a screen and a wireless radio.
translation.zh: Siftables可以用手随意移动， 每块Siftable可以互相感知彼此的移动， 每块Siftable还有显示屏和无线电装置。

translation.en: Most importantly, they're physical,  so like the blocks, you can move them just by reaching out and grasping.
translation.zh: 最重要的是，每块Siftable都是独立的， 就像积木一样，可以随意搭配。

translation.en: And Siftables are an example of a new ecosystem  of tools for manipulating digital information.
translation.zh: 而且Siftables代表了一种新的生态系统 --即数字化信息的操作工具。

translation.en: And as these tools become more physical,  more aware of their motion, aware of each other,  and aware of the nuance of how we move them,  we can start to explore some new and fun interaction styles.
translation.zh: 这种操作工具更加独立， 更加灵敏，能彼此感知， 感知任何细微的移动， 所以我们可以使用这种工具尝试一些新的有趣的互动。

translation.en: So, I'm going to start with some simple examples.
translation.zh: 现在，我就来演示一些简单的。

translation.en: This Siftable is configured to show video,  and if I tilt it in one direction, it'll roll the video this way;  if I tilt it the other way it rolls it backwards.
translation.zh: 这块Siftable有映像配置， 如果我把它向一侧倾斜，那么它所显示的画面也朝这边倾斜， 如果我把它朝反方向倾斜，那么图像也朝反方向倾斜。

translation.en: And these interactive portraits are aware of each other.
translation.zh: 而且这些Siftables能互相感知。

translation.en: So if I put them next to each other, they get interested.
translation.zh: 如果把它们一个挨一个摆好，有趣的现象就会发生。

translation.en: If they get surrounded, they notice that too,  they might get a little flustered.
translation.zh: 如果把它们随意一堆，他们也会察觉到， 那就会有点儿混乱。

translation.en: And they can also sense their motion and tilt.
translation.zh: 它们还能感知彼此的移动和倾斜。

translation.en: One of the interesting implications on interaction, we started to realize,  was that we could use everyday gestures on data,  like pouring a color the way we might pour a liquid.
translation.zh: 我们发现一个有趣的互动-- 我们可以通过一些常用的手势和Siftables进行互动， 比如象倒液体那样把颜色从一块Siftable倒入另一块Siftable.

translation.en: So in this case, we've got three Siftables configured to be paint buckets  and I can use them to pour color into that central one,  where they get mixed.
translation.zh: 我们来看这个演示，这有三块设置成油漆桶模式的Siftables, 我们可以把这些桶里的颜色倒入中间的那个， 把颜色混在一起.

translation.en: If we overshoot, we can pour a little bit back.
translation.zh: 如果倒多了，可以再倒回去一些。

translation.en: There are also some neat possibilities for education,  like language, math and logic games  where we want to give people the ability to try things quickly,  and view the results immediately.
translation.zh: Siftables还有学习机的功能， 可以用来学语言、算算术等-- 我们希望通过这些功能让学习变得快捷， 更快看到结果。

translation.en: So here I'm --    This is a Fibonacci sequence that I'm making with a simple equation program.
translation.zh: 这也是我来这里展示Siftables的原因--  这是我用一个简单方程式做成的斐波那契数列。

translation.en: Here we have a word game that's kind of like a mash-up between Scrabble and Boggle.
translation.zh: Siftables还可以玩拼字游戏--一种Scrabble和Boggle混搭的拼字游戏。

translation.en: Basically, in every round  you get a randomly assigned letter on each Siftable,  and as you try to make words it checks against a dictionary.
translation.zh: 这种拼字游戏的玩法大致如下， 你随意拿一块带有字母的Siftable, 当你把几块带有字母的Siftables拼在一起组成单词时，Siftables会在字典里自动查找单词。

translation.en: Then, after about 30 seconds, it reshuffles,  and you have a new set of letters and new possibilities to try.
translation.zh: 大约30秒后Siftables会自动根据正确的单词拼写顺序改变原来显示的字母，组成正确的单词， 你还可以尝试用其他的字母拼出新的单词。

translation.zh: 谢谢大家。

translation.zh: 而且有趣的是在玩这个拼字游戏的时候 我们并不需要向他们解释什么。

translation.en: All you have to say is, "Make words,"  and they know exactly what to do.
translation.zh: 只要跟他们说这是个“拼字”游戏时， 他们就知道该怎么做了。

translation.en: DM: So, the last example I have time to show you today  is a music sequencing and live performance tool  that we've built recently,  in which Siftables act as sounds  like lead, bass and drums.

translation.en: Thank you.

translation.en: So, as you can see,  my passion is for making new human-computer interfaces  that are a better match to the ways our brains and bodies work.
translation.zh: 正如大家看到的， 我的理想就是研发一款新型的能够人机互动的媒介 更好地配合人体大脑的运作。

translation.en: And today, I had time to show you one point in this new design space,  and a few of the possibilities that we're working to bring out of the laboratory.
translation.zh: 今天，我在这给大家展示了Siftable， 我们的后续研究正在实验室中进行。

translation.en: So the thought I want to leave you with  is that we're on the cusp of this new generation of tools  for interacting with digital media  that are going to bring information into our world  on our terms.
translation.zh: 我想跟大家交流的想法就是 我们在研发新一代尖端科技产品 --可以和数字媒体接轨的科技产品， 它将给世界带来变化 这样的革新在我们这一代就会看到。

translation.en: And the peculiar thing is that I recently wrote this book,  this memoir called "Eat, Pray, Love"  which, decidedly unlike any of my previous books,  went out in the world for some reason, and became this big,  mega-sensation, international bestseller thing.

translation.en: The result of which is that everywhere I go now,  people treat me like I'm doomed.

translation.en: And even the ones who didn't literally commit suicide  seem to be really undone by their gifts, you know.

translation.en: Norman Mailer, just before he died, last interview, he said,  "Every one of my books has killed me a little more."
translation.zh: 诺曼梅勒，在去世前的最后一次采访中说： “我的每一本书都蚕食了一部分的我”

translation.en: An extraordinary statement to make about your life's work.

translation.en: But we don't even blink when we hear somebody say this,  because we've heard that kind of stuff for so long  and somehow we've completely internalized and accepted collectively  this notion that creativity and suffering are somehow inherently linked  and that artistry, in the end, will always ultimately lead to anguish.

translation.en: And the question that I want to ask everybody here today  is are you guys all cool with that idea?

translation.zh: 哪怕稍稍离远点看这个观点，我也不能同意这种臆断 哪怕稍稍离远点看这个观点，我也不能同意这种臆断

translation.en: I think it's odious.

translation.zh: 这个观点不但可憎，而且可怕，我不希望这样的想法一直延续到下个世纪 这个观点不但可憎，而且可怕，我不希望这样的想法一直延续到下个世纪

translation.en: And I definitely know that, in my case -- in my situation --  it would be very dangerous for me to start sort of leaking down that dark path  of assumption,  particularly given the circumstance that I'm in right now in my career.
translation.zh: 而且就我自己来说，持这一观点必然将我引入黑暗的绝境 而且就我自己来说，持这一观点必然将我引入黑暗的绝境 尤其是在我目前的事业阶段 尤其是在我目前的事业阶段

translation.en: Which is -- you know, like check it out,  I'm pretty young, I'm only about 40 years old.

translation.zh: 我希望继续从事我所热爱的写作事业，所以问题就变成：我应该怎么办呢？

translation.en: And so, it seems to me, upon a lot of reflection,  that the way that I have to work now, in order to continue writing,  is that I have to create some sort of protective psychological construct, right?
translation.zh: 经过一番深入思考，在我看来 要想继续写作，我必须要创造出某种心理保护机制 要想继续写作，我必须要创造出某种心理保护机制

translation.en: I have to sort of find some way to have a safe distance  between me, as I am writing, and my very natural anxiety  about what the reaction to that writing is going to be, from now on.
translation.zh: 我必须以某种方式，建立起一个安全距离 区别开写作本身，以及我对于作品反响的极度焦虑 区别开写作本身，以及我对于作品反响的极度焦虑

translation.en: And, as I've been looking, over the last year,  for models for how to do that, I've been sort of looking across time,  and I've been trying to find other societies  to see if they might have had better and saner ideas than we have  about how to help creative people  sort of manage the inherent emotional risks of creativity.
translation.zh: 前一年，我到处找寻可以参考的模式，在历史中找，也在不同文化中找 前一年，我到处找寻可以参考的模式，在历史中找，也在不同文化中找 前一年，我到处找寻可以参考的模式，在历史中找，也在不同文化中找 看他们是否有比我们更好、更理智的观点 来帮助艺术工作者处理艺术创作所固有的内在情感风险 来帮助艺术工作者处理艺术创作所固有的内在情感风险

translation.en: And that search has led me to ancient Greece and ancient Rome.
translation.zh: 这一寻找最后把我带到了古希腊和古罗马

translation.en: So stay with me, because it does circle around and back.
translation.zh: 所以请耐心听我讲，因为最后会绕回到我们的问题

translation.en: But, ancient Greece and ancient Rome --  people did not happen to believe that creativity  came from human beings back then, OK?
translation.zh: 在古希腊和古罗马，人们并不认为创造力来自于人类本身 在古希腊和古罗马，人们并不认为创造力来自于人类本身 在古希腊和古罗马，人们并不认为创造力来自于人类本身

translation.en: People believed that creativity was this divine attendant spirit  that came to human beings from some distant and unknowable source,  for distant and unknowable reasons.
translation.zh: 人们相信，创造力是一种神圣的守护精灵 从遥远而不可知的地方来到艺术家身边，带着某种遥远而不可知的目的 从遥远而不可知的地方来到艺术家身边，带着某种遥远而不可知的目的

translation.en: The Greeks famously called these divine attendant spirits of creativity "daemons."
translation.zh: 希腊人普遍地称这种伴随着创造力的守护精灵为“守护神”

translation.en: Socrates, famously, believed that he had a daemon  who spoke wisdom to him from afar.
translation.zh: 当时人们普遍地认为苏格拉底就有这样一个守护神，从远处赋予他智慧 当时人们普遍地认为苏格拉底就有这样一个守护神，从远处赋予他智慧

translation.en: The Romans had the same idea,  but they called that sort of disembodied creative spirit a genius.
translation.zh: 古罗马人有着相似的观点，他们把这种无形的创造精灵称为“天才” 古罗马人有着相似的观点，他们把这种无形的创造精灵称为“天才”

translation.en: Which is great, because the Romans did not actually think  that a genius was a particularly clever individual.
translation.zh: 这种观点很妙，因为罗马人并没有认为“天才”是某个特别聪慧的个人 这种观点很妙，因为罗马人并没有认为“天才”是某个特别聪慧的个人

translation.en: They believed that a genius was this, sort of magical divine entity,  who was believed to literally live in the walls of an artist's studio,  kind of like Dobby the house elf, and who would come out  and sort of invisibly assist the artist with their work  and would shape the outcome of that work.
translation.zh: 他们认为“天才”是某种奇妙的神圣存在 他们甚至认为“天才”居住在艺术家工作室的墙壁中，就像小精灵多比一样 他们甚至认为“天才”居住在艺术家工作室的墙壁中，就像小精灵多比一样 它们会悄悄地钻出来，无形地帮助艺术家创作，并影响作品成败 它们会悄悄地钻出来，无形地帮助艺术家创作，并影响作品成败

translation.en: So brilliant -- there it is, right there, that distance that I'm talking about --  that psychological construct to protect you from the results of your work.
translation.zh: 这个观点简直绝了，这就是我在找寻的那个安全距离 这就是让人免受作品成败影响的心理保护机制

translation.en: And everyone knew that this is how it functioned, right?
translation.zh: 我们都可以理解它的运作模式，不是吗？

translation.en: So the ancient artist was protected from certain things,  like, for example, too much narcissism, right?
translation.zh: 古代艺术家由这个观点而得到保护，避免了过度自恋 古代艺术家由这个观点而得到保护，避免了过度自恋

translation.en: If your work was brilliant, you couldn't take all the credit for it,  everybody knew that you had this disembodied genius who had helped you.
translation.zh: 如果你的作品很伟大，那可不能完全归功于你 因为大家都知道你是在一个无形的“天才”帮助下完成作品的

translation.en: If your work bombed, not entirely your fault, you know?
translation.zh: 如果你的作品很烂，同样也不全是你的错

translation.en: Everyone knew your genius was kind of lame.   And this is how people thought about creativity in the West for a really long time.
translation.zh: 人人都知道那是因为你的“天才”很差劲 这就是西方人在过去很长一段时间里看待创作力的方式

translation.en: And then the Renaissance came and everything changed,  and we had this big idea, and the big idea was,  let's put the individual human being at the center of the universe  above all gods and mysteries,  and there's no more room for mystical creatures  who take dictation from the divine. And it's the beginning of rational humanism,  and people started to believe that creativity  came completely from the self of the individual.

translation.en: And for the first time in history,  you start to hear people referring to this or that artist as being a genius,  rather than having a genius.

translation.en: And I got to tell you, I think that was a huge error.
translation.zh: 而我要说的是，我认为那是一个巨大的错误

translation.en: You know, I think that allowing somebody, one mere person  to believe that he or she is like, the vessel,  you know, like the font and the essence and the source  of all divine, creative, unknowable, eternal mystery  is just a smidge too much responsibility to put on one fragile, human psyche.
translation.zh: 让一个人，区区一个个体 去相信他是承载着神圣、创造、未知和永恒这些事物的源泉与圣器 去相信他是承载着神圣、创造、未知和永恒这些事物的源泉与圣器 去相信他是承载着神圣、创造、未知和永恒这些事物的源泉与圣器 无异于要求他吞下太阳，这对于脆弱的个体而言，是太大的责任

translation.en: It's like asking somebody to swallow the sun.
translation.zh: 无异于要求他吞下太阳，这对于脆弱的个体而言，是太大的责任

translation.en: It just completely warps and distorts egos,  and it creates all these unmanageable expectations about performance.
translation.zh: 这彻底地扭曲了一个人的自我认知，并导致对于个人成就无比膨胀的预期 这彻底地扭曲了一个人的自我认知，并导致对于个人成就无比膨胀的预期

translation.en: And I think the pressure of that  has been killing off our artists for the last 500 years.
translation.zh: 我认为就是这种压力，在过去的500年间扼杀了无数艺术家 我认为就是这种压力，在过去的500年间扼杀了无数艺术家

translation.en: And, if this is true,  and I think it is true,  the question becomes, what now?
translation.zh: 如果真是这样 至少我认为是这样的 那么我们的问题就是：现在该怎么办？我们能够改变这种状况吗？

translation.en: Can we do this differently?
translation.zh: 那么我们的问题就是：现在该怎么办？我们能够改变这种状况吗？

translation.en: Maybe go back to some more ancient understanding  about the relationship between humans and the creative mystery.
translation.zh: 也许我们应回到更古老的过去，去参考他们对于人类与创造力的理解？ 也许我们应回到更古老的过去，去参考他们对于人类与创造力的理解？

translation.en: Maybe not.
translation.zh: 也许不行

translation.en: Maybe we can't just erase 500 years of rational humanistic thought  in one 18 minute speech.

translation.en: And there's probably people in this audience  who would raise really legitimate scientific suspicions  about the notion of, basically, fairies  who follow people around rubbing fairy juice on their projects and stuff.
translation.zh: 况且或许今天的听众中，就有人能够提出有理有据的科学质疑 况且或许今天的听众中，就有人能够提出有理有据的科学质疑 批驳这种童话精灵跟着艺术家主人，给作品上点上神仙水的可笑想法 批驳这种童话精灵跟着艺术家主人，给作品上点上神仙水的可笑想法

translation.en: I'm not, probably, going to bring you all along with me on this.
translation.zh: 也许，我无法说服你们大家都同意我的看法

translation.en: But the question that I kind of want to pose is --  you know, why not?
translation.zh: 但我想说的是：为何不呢？为什么不换个角度思考呢？ 但我想说的是：为何不呢？为什么不换个角度思考呢？

translation.en: Why not think about it this way?
translation.zh: 但我想说的是：为何不呢？为什么不换个角度思考呢？

translation.en: Because it makes as much sense as anything else I have ever heard  in terms of explaining the utter maddening capriciousness  of the creative process.
translation.zh: 就各种解释人类变化无常的创作过程的理论而言 这个精灵理论和我听过的所有其他理论一样地合理 这个精灵理论和我听过的所有其他理论一样地合理

translation.en: A process which, as anybody who has ever tried to make something --  which is to say basically everyone here ---  knows does not always behave rationally.
translation.zh: 这个过程，对于任何一个曾试图创作的人来说 相信在坐各位都曾有这方面的经历 都会知道创作过程并不总是理性的

translation.en: And, in fact, can sometimes feel downright paranormal.

translation.en: I had this encounter recently where I met the extraordinary American poet Ruth Stone,  who's now in her 90s, but she's been a poet her entire life  and she told me that when she was growing up in rural Virginia,  she would be out working in the fields,  and she said she would feel and hear a poem  coming at her from over the landscape.
translation.zh: 比方说，我最近见到杰出的美国诗人露丝.斯通 露丝已经九十多岁，她一直是一位诗人 她对我说她少年时生活在弗吉尼亚乡间的事情 她会在田间劳作着，然后突然听到并感觉到一首诗，从远处冲她而来 她会在田间劳作着，然后突然听到并感觉到一首诗，从远处冲她而来 她会在田间劳作着，然后突然听到并感觉到一首诗，从远处冲她而来

translation.en: And she said it was like a thunderous train of air.
translation.zh: 像一股雷鸣般的气息，朝她倾泻而下

translation.en: And it would come barreling down at her over the landscape.
translation.zh: 她可以感受到它的来临，因为这股力量会撼动她脚下的大地

translation.en: And she felt it coming, because it would shake the earth under her feet.
translation.zh: 她可以感受到它的来临，因为这股力量会撼动她脚下的大地

translation.en: She knew that she had only one thing to do at that point,  and that was to, in her words, "run like hell."
translation.zh: 每当此时，她唯一能做的只有一件事 用她的话说，就是“死命地狂奔”

translation.en: And she would run like hell to the house  and she would be getting chased by this poem,  and the whole deal was that she had to get to a piece of paper and a pencil  fast enough so that when it thundered through her, she could collect it  and grab it on the page.

translation.en: And other times she wouldn't be fast enough,  so she'd be running and running, and she wouldn't get to the house  and the poem would barrel through her and she would miss it  and she said it would continue on across the landscape,  looking, as she put it "for another poet."
translation.zh: 有些时候她则不够快 她拼命地跑，还没到家，那首诗已经奔腾而过，于是她便错过了那首诗 她拼命地跑，还没到家，那首诗已经奔腾而过，于是她便错过了那首诗 她说那首诗会继续在田野间穿行，寻找“下一位诗人” 她说那首诗会继续在田野间穿行，寻找“下一位诗人”

translation.en: And then there were these times --  this is the piece I never forgot --  she said that there were moments where she would almost miss it, right?
translation.zh: 在另一些时候，这是最叫我难忘的部分： 在另一些时候，这是最叫我难忘的部分： 她说有些时候她几乎就要错过一首诗了

translation.en: So, she's running to the house and she's looking for the paper  and the poem passes through her,  and she grabs a pencil just as it's going through her,  and then she said, it was like she would reach out with her other hand  and she would catch it.
translation.zh: 她飞奔回家，寻找纸笔 而那首诗即将穿越她而去，她在它正要穿过之际抓住了笔 而那首诗即将穿越她而去，她在它正要穿过之际抓住了笔 然后她会伸出另一只手，抓住那首诗的尾巴 然后她会伸出另一只手，抓住那首诗的尾巴

translation.en: And in these instances, the poem would come up on the page perfect and intact  but backwards, from the last word to the first.

translation.en: So, we've always been trying to ask big questions.
translation.zh: 我们经常试图提出一些较大的问题。

translation.en: "What is life?" is something that I think many biologists  have been trying to understand  at various levels.
translation.zh: “生命是什么”我想是许多生物学家 不断地尝试在 在不同层面去理解的问题。

translation.en: We've tried various approaches,  paring it down to minimal components.
translation.zh: 我们尝试了许多方法， 把它分解到最小的组成部分。

translation.en: We've been digitizing it now for almost 20 years;  when we sequenced the human genome,  it was going from the analog world of biology  into the digital world of the computer.
translation.zh: 到目前我们几乎已经用了20年来将其数字化。 当我们在排序人类基因组的时候， 它从生物学的模拟分析世界 走进了计算机的数字世界。

translation.en: Now we're trying to ask, "Can we regenerate life  or can we create new life  out of this digital universe?"
translation.zh: 现在我们在尝试提问，我们是否能够再造生命， 或者我们是否从这个数字世界中 能创造新的生命?

translation.en: This is the map of a small organism,  Mycoplasma genitalium,  that has the smallest genome for a species  that can self-replicate in the laboratory,  and we've been trying to just see if  we can come up with an even smaller genome.
translation.zh: 这是一种微生物的基因序列图, 生殖支原体, 它有着对于一个物种来说最小的基因组 能使其在实验室中自我复制。 并且我们在尝试了解是否 我们能找到一种更小的基因组。

translation.en: We're able to knock out on the order of 100 genes  out of the 500 or so that are here.
translation.zh: 我们能够从500组基因中 分离出一百组就是我们眼前的这些。

translation.en: When we look at its metabolic map,  it's relatively simple  compared to ours --  trust me, this is simple --  but when we look at all the genes  that we can knock out one at a time,  it's very unlikely that this would yield  a living cell.
translation.zh: 但当我们来看它的新陈代谢的时候， 这其实是相对简单的 相对我们的来说。 相信我，这算简单的。 但当我们在看所有这些 我们能一个一个分离出的基因组的时候， 很难相信它们能产生出 一个活生生的细胞。

translation.en: So we decided the only way forward  was to actually synthesize this chromosome  so we could vary the components  to ask some of these most fundamental questions.
translation.zh: 所以，我们认为唯一能继续研究的方法 就是人工合成这些染色体 以便我们能改变它的组成部分 来继续提问这些最基本的问题。

translation.en: And so we started down the road of:  can we synthesize a chromosome?
translation.zh: 于是我们开始沿着这条路走下去 “我们能人工合成染色体吗？”

translation.en: Can chemistry permit making  these really large molecules  where we've never been before?
translation.zh: 化学原则真的允许我们制造 这些我们从未实现过的 超大分子吗？

translation.en: And if we do, can we boot up a chromosome?
translation.zh: 而且，就算我们可以，我们能激活它吗？

translation.en: A chromosome, by the way, is just a piece of inert chemical material.
translation.zh: 一对染色体，顺便说下，只是一些无活性的化学物质。

translation.en: So, our pace of digitizing life has been increasing  at an exponential pace.
translation.zh: 我们数字化生命的速度不断地 以指数速度加快。

translation.en: Our ability to write the genetic code  has been moving pretty slowly  but has been increasing,  and our latest point would put it on, now, an exponential curve.
translation.zh: 我们写基因编码的能力 进步地却非常慢， 不过也还是在增加的。 我们最近的状况将会把速度提升到指数曲线。

translation.en: We started this over 15 years ago.
translation.zh: 我们于15年前开始这项工作。

translation.en: It took several stages, in fact,  starting with a bioethical review before we did the first experiments.
translation.zh: 实际上它经过了好几个阶段。 在我们做最初的试验前，先进行了一次生物伦理学的评估。

translation.en: But it turns out synthesizing DNA  is very difficult.
translation.zh: 但结果是人工合成DNA 是非常困难的。

translation.en: There are tens of thousands of machines around the world  that make small pieces of DNA --  30 to 50 letters in length --  and it's a degenerate process, so the longer you make the piece,  the more errors there are.
translation.zh: 全世界有十几万台设备 在制造小片断的DNA， 长度在30到50个字符， 并且这是一个会倒退的过程，制造的片断越是长， 产生的错误就越是多。

translation.en: So we had to create a new method  for putting these little pieces together and correct all the errors.
translation.zh: 所以我们不得不创造一种新的方法 把这些小的片断排放在一起并纠正所有的错误。

translation.en: And this was our first attempt, starting with the digital information  of the genome of phi X174.
translation.zh: 这是我们的第一次尝试，从Phi X 174基因组 的数字信息开始。

translation.en: It's a small virus that kills bacteria.
translation.zh: 是一种能杀死细菌的小型病毒。

translation.en: We designed the pieces, went through our error correction  and had a DNA molecule  of about 5,000 letters.
translation.zh: 我们设计了它的基因片断，经过了错误纠正， 就拥有了一条 5000字符长度的DNA。

translation.en: The exciting phase came when we took this piece of inert chemical  and put it in the bacteria,  and the bacteria started to read this genetic code,  made the viral particles.
translation.zh: 最另人兴奋的阶段是当我们把这段没有活性的化学物质 放进细菌内， 细菌开始读取基因编码， 制造了病毒粒子。

translation.en: The viral particles then were released from the cells  and came back and killed the E. coli.
translation.zh: 接着细胞释放出病毒粒子， 再返回来杀死了E.coli。

translation.en: I was talking to the oil industry recently  and I said they clearly understood that model.
translation.zh: 我最近与石油行业有一些交流， 我觉得他们对这个模式理解的非常透彻。

translation.en: They laughed more than you guys are.   And so, we think this is a situation  where the software can actually build its own hardware  in a biological system.
translation.zh: 他比你们笑的大声多了。 因此我们认为这种情况实际上 是软件能在一个生物系统内 打造自己的硬件。

translation.en: But we wanted to go much larger:  we wanted to build the entire bacterial chromosome --  it's over 580,000 letters of genetic code --  so we thought we'd build them in cassettes the size of the viruses  so we could actually vary the cassettes  to understand  what the actual components of a living cell are.
translation.zh: 但我们还想再扩大规模。 我们希望制造整条细菌染色体， 一条超过580，000字符长度的基因编码。 我们认为应该在以病毒大小的“盒”中制造它们 这样我们可以改变这些“盒” 来理解 一个活的细胞的实际组成部分是什么？

translation.en: Design is critical,  and if you're starting with digital information in the computer,  that digital information has to be really accurate.
translation.zh: 设计是非常重要的， 并且如果你在计算机上开始使用数字信息。 那这些数字信息必须十分准确。

translation.en: When we first sequenced this genome in 1995,  the standard of accuracy was one error per 10,000 base pairs.
translation.zh: 当我们在1995年第一次对这组基因排序时， 准确率的标准是每10000个基本对一个错误。

translation.en: We actually found, on resequencing it,  30 errors; had we used that original sequence,  it never would have been able to be booted up.
translation.zh: 实际上我们发现，在重新排序时， 平均是30个错误。如果我们使用原先的序列， 这组基因永远不可能被启动。

translation.en: Part of the design is designing pieces  that are 50 letters long  that have to overlap with all the other 50-letter pieces  to build smaller subunits  we have to design so they can go together.
translation.zh: 设计工作的一部分是设计 50个字符长度的片断 并和其他的50字符长的片段叠加 以构建更小的次单元。 我们要设计过他们才能聚到一起。

translation.en: We design unique elements into this.
translation.zh: 其中有我们设计过的独特部分。

translation.en: You may have read that we put watermarks in.
translation.zh: 你们可能听说过我们在其中加入了水印

translation.en: Think of this:  we have a four-letter genetic code -- A, C, G and T.
translation.zh: 想想看 基因编码有四个字符：A,C,G和T。

translation.en: Triplets of those letters  code for roughly 20 amino acids,  such that there's a single letter designation  for each of the amino acids.
translation.zh: 这些字符的三联体 - 以及这些字符 编成了大约20种氨基酸 这样每个氨基酸就有了 一个字符标记

translation.en: So we can use the genetic code to write out words,  sentences, thoughts.
translation.zh: 所以我们能使用基因编码来书写言语 句子，想法。

translation.en: Initially, all we did was autograph it.
translation.zh: 最初，我们所做的就是用它来签名。

translation.en: Some people were disappointed there was not poetry.
translation.zh: 有些人有点失望我们没用它来做首诗。

translation.en: We designed these pieces so  we can just chew back with enzymes;  there are enzymes that repair them and put them together.
translation.zh: 我们设计了这些片断 并能使用酶来裁切。 有些酶是用来修复他们并把他们放到一起的。

translation.en: And we started making pieces,  starting with pieces that were 5,000 to 7,000 letters,  put those together to make 24,000-letter pieces,  then put sets of those going up to 72,000.
translation.zh: 接着我们开始制造片断， 从7000字符长度的片断开始 把他们拼在一起制造24，000字符长度的片断 再把几组片断合并，变成了72，000长的片断

translation.en: At each stage, we grew up these pieces in abundance  so we could sequence them  because we're trying to create a process that's extremely robust  that you can see in a minute.
translation.zh: 在每个阶段，我们大量培养了这些片断 因此我们可以给他们排序 因为我们希望创造一个异常可靠的过程 一分钟内你就将看见

translation.en: We're trying to get to the point of automation.
translation.zh: 我们试着达到自动化的层面

translation.en: So, this looks like a basketball playoff.
translation.zh: 这看起来就像是一场篮球赛的对阵图

translation.en: When we get into these really large pieces  over 100,000 base pairs,  they won't any longer grow readily in E. coli --  it exhausts all the modern tools of molecular biology --  and so we turned to other mechanisms.
translation.zh: 当这些非常大的片断超过 100，000基本对时 他们就很难继续在E.coil里长的更长了。 在试尽了各种现代分子生物学的工具后 我们转向其他的途径。

translation.en: We knew there's a mechanism called homologous recombination  that biology uses to repair DNA  that can put pieces together.
translation.zh: 我们知道有个方法叫同源重组， 生物学上用来修复DNA， 它能把片断组合到一起

translation.en: Here's an example of it:  there's an organism called  Deinococcus radiodurans  that can take three millions rads of radiation.
translation.zh: 这里有一个例子 有一种微生物叫 耐辐射球菌 能够承受三百万度的辐射量。

translation.en: You can see in the top panel, its chromosome just gets blown apart.
translation.zh: 你能看到在顶部的视图里，它的染色体四散在各个地方

translation.en: Twelve to 24 hours later, it put it  back together exactly as it was before.
translation.zh: 12到24小时以后，它将自己 又组合回之前的原状。

translation.en: We have thousands of organisms that can do this.
translation.zh: 我们有数千种微生物有这种能耐

translation.en: These organisms can be totally desiccated;  they can live in a vacuum.
translation.zh: 这些微生物能够完全脱离水。 他们能存活在真空中

translation.en: I am absolutely certain that life can exist in outer space,  move around, find a new aqueous environment.
translation.zh: 我完全确信外层空间存在着生命， 四处移动，遇到一个新的有水的环境

translation.en: In fact, NASA has shown a lot of this is out there.
translation.zh: 实际上，NASA已经展示过很多这样的例子。

translation.en: Here's an actual micrograph of the molecule we built  using these processes, actually just using yeast mechanisms  with the right design of the pieces we put them in;  yeast puts them together automatically.
translation.zh: 这里有一组我们拍摄的这个分子的显微图像。 通过这些过程，其实就是前面所提到的酵母的方法 同时放入经过我们正确设计的片断。 酵母自动地将他们聚合。

translation.en: This is not an electron micrograph;  this is just a regular photomicrograph.
translation.zh: 这并不是电子显微图像； 它仅仅是普通的光学显微镜。

translation.en: It's such a large molecule  we can see it with a light microscope.
translation.zh: 这是如此之大的一个分子 我们能用一个光学显微镜观察它。

translation.en: These are pictures over about a six-second period.
translation.zh: 这些是时长约为六秒的图像。

translation.en: So, this is the publication we had just a short while ago.
translation.zh: 这是我们所公开的最近的试验成果。

translation.en: This is over 580,000 letters of genetic code;  it's the largest molecule ever made by humans of a defined structure.
translation.zh: 这是超过580000字符长的基因编码。 这也是由人类设定结构并制造的最大的分子。

translation.en: It's over 300 million molecular weight.
translation.zh: 它超过了3亿分子重量。

translation.en: If we printed it out at a 10 font with no spacing,  it takes 142 pages  just to print this genetic code.
translation.zh: 如果我们以10号字体不间隔地将其打印出来。 总共需要142页 来打印这些基因编码

translation.en: Well, how do we boot up a chromosome? How do we activate this?
translation.zh: 那我们该如何来启动一段染色体，我们该如何激活它?

translation.en: Obviously, with a virus it's pretty simple;  it's much more complicated dealing with bacteria.
translation.zh: 显然处理一个病毒非常简单 处理一个细菌就复杂多了

translation.en: into eukaryotes like ourselves:  you can just pop out the nucleus  and pop in another one,  and that's what you've all heard about with cloning.
translation.zh: 处理像我们自身这样的 真核生物也相对简单 你能取出一个细胞核 然后塞进另一个细胞中， 这就是大家听到的关于克隆的手法

translation.en: With bacteria and Archaea, the chromosome is integrated into the cell,  but we recently showed that we can do a complete transplant  of a chromosome from one cell to another  and activate it.
translation.zh: 对于古细菌，它们的染色体与整个细胞连成一体， 但最近我们也明确了我们能完成一个完整的移植 将染色体从一个细胞转移到另一个细胞中 并激活它。

translation.en: We purified a chromosome from one microbial species --  roughly, these two are as distant as human and mice --  we added a few extra genes  so we could select for this chromosome,  we digested it with enzymes  to kill all the proteins,  and it was pretty stunning when we put this in the cell --  and you'll appreciate  our very sophisticated graphics here.
translation.zh: 我们从一个种群的微生物中提取出染色体。 基本上，这两个的差别就如同人类和老鼠般。 我们加上了一些新的基因 这样我们就能选择这些染色体。 我们用酶来分解它们 去除所有的蛋白质 当我们将它放入细胞时发生的情形非常惊人 你们应该会喜欢 我们所制作的非常精密的演示图像 --

translation.en: The new chromosome went into the cell.
translation.zh: 新的染色体进入细胞。

translation.en: In fact, we thought this might be as far as it went,  but we tried to design the process a little bit further.
translation.zh: 实际上我们原以为这个过程就到此为止了。 但是我们试图将这个过程设计得更深入一些。

translation.en: This is a major mechanism of evolution right here.
translation.zh: 这是一个重大的进化机制。

translation.en: We find all kinds of species  that have taken up a second chromosome  or a third one from somewhere,  adding thousands of new traits  in a second to that species.
translation.zh: 我们发现所有接受了 第二段染色体的物种 或来自其他地方的第三方染色体， 在一秒钟内增加了 数千种新特征到其自身。

translation.en: So, people who think of evolution  as just one gene changing at a time  have missed much of biology.
translation.zh: 原本人们所持有的在进化的过程中 每次只会有一个基因发生变化 的观念忽略了生物的许多实际情况。

translation.en: There are enzymes called restriction enzymes  that actually digest DNA.
translation.zh: 有一种酶叫做限制酶 是能够消化DNA的

translation.en: The chromosome that was in the cell  doesn't have one;  the chromosome we put in does.
translation.zh: 原先细胞中的染色体没有这种酶 没有这种酶 而当我们置入一段拥有这种酶的染色体

translation.en: It got expressed and it recognized  the other chromosome as foreign material,  chewed it up, and so we ended up  just with a cell with the new chromosome.
translation.zh: 它表现了出来，并且辨认出 另一段染色体是外来物质， 它就将其消化，最后我们就有了 一个包含有新的DNA的细胞

translation.en: It turned blue because of the genes we put in it.
translation.zh: 我们放入的基因导致它变成了蓝色。

translation.en: And with a very short period of time,  all the characteristics of one species were lost  and it converted totally into the new species  based on the new software that we put in the cell.
translation.zh: 在非常短的一段时间里， 所有的原先物种的特征全部消失了， 并且完全转化成了一个新物种， 基于我们放入细胞的新“软件”。

translation.en: All the proteins changed,  the membranes changed;  when we read the genetic code, it's exactly what we had transferred in.
translation.zh: 所有的蛋白质都改变了， 细胞膜也改变了 -- 当我们读取它的基因编码，实际上就是我们植入的那种。

translation.en: So, this may sound like genomic alchemy,  but we can, by moving the software of DNA around,  change things quite dramatically.
translation.zh: 这可能听起来像基因炼金术， 但我们的确能通过转移DNA， 来急剧地改变事物。

translation.en: Now I've argued, this is not genesis;  this is building on three and a half billion years of evolution.
translation.zh: 现在，我要声明这不是创世纪 -- 这是建立在35亿年的进化上的

translation.en: And I've argued that we're about to perhaps  create a new version of the Cambrian explosion,  where there's massive new speciation based on this digital design.
translation.zh: 并且我认为我们可能 会创造新一版的寒武纪生命大爆发 出现大量基于这种数字化设计

translation.en: Why do this?
translation.zh: 的新物种 为什么要这样做？

translation.en: I think this is pretty obvious in terms of some of the needs.
translation.zh: 我认为出于一些需求我们这样做的原因是非常明显的。

translation.en: We're about to go from six and a half  to nine billion people over the next 40 years.
translation.zh: 我们的人口将在接下来的40年中从 65亿变成90亿

translation.en: To put it in context for myself:  I was born in 1946.
translation.zh: 以我自己的例子来说 我出生于1946年

translation.en: There are now three people on the planet  for every one of us that existed in 1946;  within 40 years, there'll be four.
translation.zh: 现在世界上就变成了三个人 相对于我们中每一个从1946年就存在的人； 在接下来的四十年内，就变成了四个。

translation.en: We have trouble feeding, providing fresh, clean water,  medicines, fuel  for the six and a half billion.
translation.zh: 我们在为65亿人提供食物，洁净的淡水， 医药，燃料上 都十分困难。

translation.en: It's going to be a stretch to do it for nine.
translation.zh: 换作90亿人那真是捉襟见肘了。

translation.en: We use over five billion tons of coal,  30 billion-plus barrels of oil --  that's a hundred million barrels a day.
translation.zh: 我们使用超过50亿顿的煤， 300多亿桶的石油。 也就是每天一千万桶。

translation.en: When we try to think of biological processes  or any process to replace that,  it's going to be a huge challenge.
translation.zh: 当我们尝试思考这个生物程序 或者任何能替代它的程序， 这会是一个巨大的挑战。

translation.en: Then of course, there's all that  CO2 from this material  that ends up in the atmosphere.
translation.zh: 接下来，当然，是这份材料 中所显示的被排放在大气层中 的二氧化碳。

translation.en: We now, from our discovery around the world,  have a database with about 20 million genes,  and I like to think of these as the design components of the future.
translation.zh: 我们现在从全球各地的发现 有了一个包含约两千万组基因的数据库， 并且我乐于把它们看作是未来的设计组件。

translation.en: The electronics industry only had a dozen or so components,  and look at the diversity that came out of that.
translation.zh: 电气行业只有十来种组件， 再看看从中能得到的多样性。

translation.en: We're limited here primarily  by a biological reality  and our imagination.
translation.zh: 目前我们主要的限制来自于 生物学的现实情况 以及我们的想像力。

translation.en: We now have techniques,  because of these rapid methods of synthesis,  to do what we're calling combinatorial genomics.
translation.zh: 我们现在拥有这样的技术， 是因为这些能制造我们称之为“混合染色体组”的 快速的人工合成方法。

translation.en: We have the ability now to build a large robot  that can make a million chromosomes a day.
translation.zh: 我们现在所拥有的制造一个大型机器人的能力 能让我们每天制造一百万个染色体。

translation.en: When you think of processing these 20 million different genes  or trying to optimize processes  to produce octane or to produce pharmaceuticals,  new vaccines,  we can just with a small team,  than the last 20 years of all science.
translation.zh: 当你想着加工这两千万组不同的基因， 并尝试去优化这个步骤 以产生辛烷或者制造药物制剂， 以及新的疫苗， 我们就能改变，即使是一个小团队， 也能做比过去20年科学史所做过的 更多的分子生物学工作。

translation.en: And it's just standard selection:  we can select for viability,  chemical or fuel production,  vaccine production, etc.
translation.zh: 并且这只是标准选择。 我们可以以生存能力来选择， 化学或燃料生产， 疫苗生产等等。

translation.en: This is a screen snapshot  of some true design software  that we're working on to actually be able to sit down  and design species in the computer.
translation.zh: 这是一张屏幕截图 截取的是一些我们 实际坐下来工作时在电脑中 真正用来设计物种的设计软件。

translation.en: You know, we don't know necessarily what it'll look like:  we know exactly what their genetic code looks like.
translation.zh: 我们并不一定要知道它看起来是怎样。 我们确切地知道它们的基因编码究竟是什么样的。

translation.en: We're focusing on now fourth-generation fuels.
translation.zh: 我们目前把注意力放在“第四代燃料”上。

translation.en: You've seen recently, corn to ethanol  is just a bad experiment.
translation.zh: 你们最近看到了将谷物转化成乙醇 只是一个糟糕的试验。

translation.en: This is Seadragon, and it's an environment  in which you can either locally or remotely interact  with vast amounts of visual data.
